@judyjoseph @arista-nwolfe Please help review this PR. Thanks

Hi @rajshekhar-nexthop , thanks so much for your detail analysis and fixing. I think your PR is good. But I don't fully understand how it happened.
Do you mean the entries in APPL_DB are correct, but they are not correct in ASIC_DB?
It surprised me, could you please share the sairedis.rec and swss.rec on the bad side?

> Hi @rajshekhar-nexthop , thanks so much for your detail analysis and fixing. I think your PR is good. But I don't fully understand how it happened. Do you mean the entries in APPL_DB are correct, but they are not correct in ASIC_DB? It surprised me, could you please share the sairedis.rec and swss.rec on the bad side?

   Thanks @Pterosaur !

     > Do you mean the entries in APPL_DB are correct, but they are not correct in ASIC_DB?
   Yes. In this case CONFIG_DB/APPL_DB were correct on both DUT and VM (XPN‑256 profile, non‑zero SALT/SSCI in MACSEC_*_SA_TABLE), and the VM’s ASIC_DB matched that. On the DUT only, the ASIC_DB SAs were wrong: they had the right SAK but SALT=0, SSCI=0, and the SCs still showed the non‑XPN cipher. That mismatch (control plane says XPN with SALT/SSCI, but ASIC has non‑XPN + zero SALT/SSCI) is what caused all packets to be rejected on the peer.
   
     > could you please share the sairedis.rec and swss.rec on the bad side?
   I didn’t capture the full sairedis.rec / swss.rec for the original failure, only snippets showing the SC being created with GCM_AES_128 and later a SET to GCM_AES_XPN_* that didn’t take effect in ASIC_DB. I’ll try to reproduce this issue again on the hardware platform, capture the full sairedis.rec and swss.rec, and then attach those complete logs to this PR for you to review.  But even if the SC cipher SET had taken effect, the SAs on the DUT were already created during the non‑XPN window with SALT=0 / SSCI=0, and those attributes are CREATE_ONLY in SAI, so they would still remain zero and keep breaking dataplane
@vmittal-msft, can you please approve this PR for 202511
